MCQ: Who coined the term machine learning in 1959?
Choices: a: Donald Hebb | b: Tom M. Mitchell | c: Arthur Samuel | d: Walter Pitts

MCQ: What was the name of the experimental 'learning machine' developed by Raytheon Company in the early 1960s?
Choices: a: Cyberspace | b: Cybernetics | c: Cybertron | d: Cybersecurity

MCQ: Who proposed the early mathematical models of neural networks to come up with algorithms that mirror human thought processes?
Choices: a: Warren McCulloch | b: Tom M. Mitchell | c: Donald Hebb | d: Arthur Samuel

MCQ: According to Tom M. Mitchell, what is the definition of machine learning algorithms?
Choices: a: Learning from data with respect to some class of tasks | b: Learning from experience with respect to some class of tasks | c: Learning from textbooks with respect to some class of tasks | d: Learning from teachers with respect to some class of tasks

MCQ: What are the two objectives of modern-day machine learning?
Choices: a: To create data models and predict future outcomes | b: To classify data based on models and make predictions for future outcomes | c: To analyze data patterns and predict future outcomes | d: To develop algorithms and classify data based on models
